body.p: To His Excelency Jas F Robinson Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your Petitioners would Beg Leave to Reprsent to your Excelency that at the Sept term of the Powell Circuit Court 1861 that the Commonwealth obtained a Judgement against John H. Danchen & Thomas Martin for the Sum of Fifty dollars Each for Carring Conceald Weapons,, and they would further Represent that at the time of the finding of Said Judgement that the Said Danchen and Martin had volunrtered in the United States Army in Capt G. M. Jackson Company and the 4th Ky Regement ^of Ky Vol^ then at Camp Roberson,, and that the Said Danchen & Martin were Put in the Powell Jail in default of the Pament of Said Judgement

and they would further represent to youre Excelency that J N B Hardwick our County Judge a devoted Union Man and one that took a great interest in making up Capt Jackson's Company Repleved the fines for Said Danchen & Martin and took them out of Jail and Sent them to there Command they Promising it him that when they drew there money for there Services from the United States that they would Send him the money to pay Said fines ^but^ they are Still in the Service and have failed to to Send the money as they promised,, and they are now Endevoring to Collect Said Judgements out of Said Hardwick which will be verry oppressive on him if he has it to pay
and we think Honestly taking Every thing into consideration that the case presents Strong grounds for the Exercise of Executive Clemency and we would aske youre Excelency to Remit Said fines.

Yours with due respect
Jan 24th 1863
Johnson A, Dawson D, S, P, C
John F. Halley J P C
C D Creed C. N. C.
M Stewartt
Thos C Purdy C. P. C.C.

Powell Cir. Ct
Remitted
J F Robinson
$50 each } Weapons
Jno. H. Danchen
Thos Martin
Issd Feby 3. 1863
